alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Grady; Thomas (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 4:11PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Decatur, Grady, southern Mitchell and Thomas Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 411 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Whigham to 11 miles southwest of Thomasville. Movement was north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cairo, Thomasville, Pelham, Camilla, Boston, Ochlocknee, Pavo, Coolidge, Whigham, Barwick, Thomasville Municipal A/P, Capel, Dillon, Enon, Everett, Cotton, Rocky Hill, Merrillville, Chastain and Harrells Still. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
